data.enText: not working hard
an idle student
not in use
to lie/stand/remain idle
without work

data.chText: 现在有超过百分之十的劳动力闲置。
data.enText: Over ten per cent of the workforce is now idle.

data.chText: 漫无目的的；无效的；无用的
data.enText: with no particular purpose or effect; useless
idle chatter/curiosity

data.chText: 那只不过是吓唬吓唬而已。
data.enText: It was just an idle threat (= not serious) .

data.chText: 佯称他们的婚姻有多美满是无意义的。
data.enText: It is idle to pretend that their marriage is a success.
not spent doing work or sth particular
In idle moments, he carved wooden figures.
the devil makes work for idle hands
people who do not have enough to do often start to do wrong

data.chText: 她认为那些违法行为是当地的无业青少年所为，总是说：“人一闲，惹麻烦”。
data.enText: She blamed the crimes on the local jobless teenagers. ‘The devil makes work for idle hands,’ she would say.

data.chText: 她在被迫闲散了一段时间之后，找到了份新工作。
data.enText: After a period of enforced idleness, she found a new job.
to spend time doing nothing important

data.chText: 他们天天在闲聊和看电视中消磨时光。
data.enText: They idled the days away, talking and watching television.
They idled along by the river (= walked slowly and with no particular purpose) .
to run slowly while the vehicle is not moving

data.chText: 她把汽车挂空挡停在路边。
data.enText: She left the car idling at the roadside.

data.chText: （尤指暂时地）关闭工厂，使（工人）闲着
data.enText: to close a factory, etc. or stop providing work for the workers, especially temporarily

data.chText: 罢工使近4 000名工人闲着没事干。
data.enText: The strikes have idled nearly 4 000 workers.

means: (尤指暂时地)关闭工厂，使(工人)闲着

data.enText: the devil makes work for idle hands
people who do not have enough to do often start to do wrong

data.chText: 她认为那些违法行为是当地的无业青少年所为，总是说：“人一闲，惹麻烦”。
data.enText: She blamed the crimes on the local jobless teenagers. ‘The devil makes work for idle hands,’ she would say.

tr: the state of an engine or other mechanism that is idling
example: the car engine was running at idle
The old man sat and stagnated on his porch
He slugged in bed all morning
the machinery sat idle during the strike

tr: not in action or at work

example: many people in the area were out of work

tr: lacking a sense of restraint or responsibility
without a basis in reason or fact

value.def: If people who were working are idle, they have no jobs or work.

example.ex: Employees have been idle almost a month because of shortages.
example.tran: 由于原料短缺，员工们已将近一个月无事可做。

value.def: If machines or factories are idle, they are not working or being used.

example.ex: Now the machine is lying idle.
example.tran: 如今机器闲置着。

example.ex: ...factories that had been idle for years.
example.tran: 已经闲置多年的工厂

value.def: If you say that someone is idle, you disapprove of them because they are not doing anything and you think they should be.

example.ex: ...idle bureaucrats who spent the day reading newspapers...
example.tran: 无所事事、整天看报纸的官僚们

example.ex: I never met such an idle bunch of workers in all my life!
example.tran: 我一辈子都没碰到过像他们这样吃白饭的工人！

value.tran: 懒散的;懒惰的;无所事事的

example.ex: Idleness is a very bad thing for human nature.
example.tran: 懒散是人性中很糟糕的一面。

example.ex: We were not idly sitting around.
example.tran: 我们并非坐着没事干。

value.def: Idle is used to describe something that you do for no particular reason, often because you have nothing better to do.

example.ex: Brian kept up the idle chatter for another five minutes.
example.tran: 布赖恩又絮絮地唠叨了5分钟。

example.ex: ...idle curiosity.
example.tran: 无聊的好奇心

value.tran: 琐碎无聊的;毫无意义的

example.ex: We talked idly about magazines and baseball...
example.tran: 我们漫不经心地谈论杂志和棒球。

example.ex: 'Has there been an accident?' Gary asked, idly curious.
example.tran: “出什么事故了吗?”加里问道，漫不经心又好奇。

value.def: If you say that it is idle to do something, you mean that it is not worth doing it, because it will not achieve anything.

example.ex: It would be idle to pretend the system is perfect.
example.tran: 假装系统完美无疵是徒劳的。

value.def: You refer to an idle threat or boast when you do not think the person making it will or can do what they say.

example.ex: It was more of an idle threat than anything...
example.tran: 那其实是唬人的话。

example.ex: His statement isn't merely an idle boast.
example.tran: 他的话不仅仅是虚张声势的自夸。

value.def: If you idle, you spend time in a lazy way, doing nothing in particular.

example.ex: When they reached his house, Scobie idled a bit, finishing his cigarette...
example.tran: 他们到他家后，斯科比闲逛了一会儿，抽完了他的香烟。

example.ex: We spent many hours idling in one of the cafes that line three sides of the tiny piazza...
example.tran: 露天小市场的三面都有小餐馆，我们在其中一家餐馆闲呆了很长时间。

example.ex: He idled around afterwards, window shopping until about 5pm.
example.tran: 然后他就闲逛，浏览橱窗直到下午 5 点钟左右。

value.def: To idle a factory or other place of work means to close it down because there is no work to do or because the workers are on strike.

example.ex: ...idled assembly plants.
example.tran: 停业的装配厂

value.boxr_value: in BRIT, usually use 英国英语通常用 shut down

value.def: To idle workers means to stop them working.

example.ex: The strike has idled about 55,000 machinists.
example.tran: 罢工使约 55,000 名机械师无事可做。

value.boxr_value: in BRIT, use 英国英语用 lay off

value.def: If an engine or vehicle is idling, the engine is running slowly and quietly because it is not in gear, and the vehicle is not moving.

example.ex: Beyond a stand of trees a small plane idled...
example.tran: 在树林的那一边,一架小飞机停在那里,发动机在空转。

example.ex: Her Daimler limo waits with its engine idling.
example.tran: 她的戴姆勒豪华轿车原地待命,发动机在空转。

trans: 停机（停歇，故障，中断运转）时间
虚度；荒废；虚度年华；虚度时光；蹉跎
怠速；怠速转速；引擎怠速；空转速度；发动机怠速
空闲态；空闲状态；闲置状态；待机状态；与闲置状况
空闲模式；空闲方式；闲置模式；空闲状态；待机模式
闲置生产能力；备用（储备）容量；备用电容
空转；空行程；空载运转；空动
